item.title: Cuban cigar festival called off as US blockade worsens energy crisis
item.content:encoded: The annual aficionados' bonanza has been postponed until further notice as shortages affect international travel.

item.title: 'England have no chance at T20 World Cup if they do not improve'
item.content:encoded: England got back to winning ways against Scotland but their T20 World Cup hopes look slim unless there are significant improvements, writes Matthew Henry.

item.title: Mansfield's Reed scores fabulous free-kick to upset Burnley
item.content:encoded: Watch Mansfield Town's Louis Reed produce "set-piece sorcery," scoring a sensational free kick to stun Premier League side Burnley and reach the FA Cup fifth round.

item.title: Church must learn from abuse victims, says new Catholic Archbishop
item.content:encoded: Archbishop Richard Moth was speaking to a 2,000-strong congregation during his installation at Westminster Cathedral.

item.title: Russia killed opposition leader Alexei Navalny using dart frog toxin, UK says
item.content:encoded: There is no innocent explanation for the toxin being found in samples taken from Navalny's body, Foreign Office says.

item.title: Ireland survive scare from superb Italy in Dublin
item.content:encoded: Ireland survive a major scare from Italy to claim their first win in this year's Six Nations and deny the Azzurri a first championship victory in Dublin.

item.title: Europe must be ready to fight, PM tells Munich Security Conference
item.content:encoded: The prime minister's speech comes after a tumultuous week in his political career back home.

item.title: Skier makes history for Brazil by winning gold in giant slalom
item.content:encoded: Lucas Pinheiro Braathen makes history for Brazil by clinching his nation's first Winter Olympic medal with gold in the giant slalom.

item.title: One giant boys' club? Why Westminster can still feel like a man's world
item.content:encoded: The decision to appoint Peter Mandelson has prompted soul searching about women’s role in government, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

item.title: Scottish craft beer brand Brewdog put up for sale
item.content:encoded: Consultants Alix Partners have been brought in to oversee the sales process which could lead to the businesses being broken up.

item.title: Rubio speech signals US-Europe relations are bruised but still friendly
item.content:encoded: The US Secretary of State sounds a conciliatory tone as he addresses European leaders in Munich.

item.title: Ex-Reform MP Rupert Lowe launches new party
item.content:encoded: The new party is set up by former Reform UK member, Rupert Lowe.

item.title: GB women shock curling world champions Canada
item.content:encoded: Great Britain's women curlers kickstart their campaign with a superb first victory of the 2026 Winter Olympics, beating medal contenders Canada 7-6.

item.title: Canada accused of cheating again in curling row
item.content:encoded: For the second time in two matches, Canadian curler Marc Kennedy has been accused of cheating by an opponent at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: William and Catherine all smiles in Valentine's Day photograph
item.content:encoded: The previously unseen photo was shared with the caption "Happy Valentine's Day" along with a heart emoji.

item.title: Queen's letter of support left Gisèle Pelicot 'overwhelmed'
item.content:encoded: The Queen's note said Gisèle Pelicot's courage had "created a powerful legacy that will change the narrative around shame, forever".

item.title: Rising vet costs leave charity with £400k bill
item.content:encoded: The group, based in Solihull and Wolverhampton, says its vet bills are costing them more.

item.title: Watch: 'I am a survivor' Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC Newsnight
item.content:encoded: Ms Pelicot reveals it is "inconceivable" that the man she shared her life with "could have committed these horrors".

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC: I felt crushed by horror - but I don't feel anger
item.content:encoded: In an extensive interview with Newsnight, the woman at the heart of France's biggest rape trial speaks about betrayal, healing and choosing the right path.

item.title: Andrew facing claim he shared Treasury document with banking contact
item.content:encoded: Reports suggest the former prince shared a Treasury document when he was serving as trade envoy.

item.title: Are families being priced out of restaurants?
item.content:encoded: The restaurant industry says it is facing a double whammy - rising costs and customers with less money.

item.title: Are families being priced out of restaurants?
item.content:encoded: The restaurant industry says it is facing a double whammy - rising costs and customers with less money.

item.title: Why Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi's 'mutual obsession' is giving some fans the ick
item.content:encoded: Romance rumours have swirled around the Wuthering Heights co-stars. But is all as it seems?

item.title: Rae fell for a chatbot called Barry, but their love might die when ChatGPT-4o is switched off
item.content:encoded: Rae began speaking to Barry after a difficult divorce, but Barry lives on an old model of ChatGPT that's being shut down.

item.title: He was once a teen 'superstar'. But James Van Der Beek's cancer left him cash-strapped
item.content:encoded: A fundraiser was set up to help the actor's family after expensive cancer treatments devastated their finances.

item.title: GB's Muir starts big air campaign - Saturday's guide
item.content:encoded: What's happening and who to look out for at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina.

item.title: Heathrow not crowded but people walk in 'wrong place', says boss
item.content:encoded: Chief executive Thomas Woldbye says Europeans and Brits keep "crashing into each other" because they walk on different sides.

item.title: Amazon's Ring ends deal with surveillance firm after backlash
item.content:encoded: A Super Bowl advert had sparked new scrutiny of the smart doorbell company's privacy practices.

item.title: Inflation eases in US as prices for used cars fall
item.content:encoded: Prices rose by 2.4% in the year to January, the latest official figures show, the slowest pace since May.

item.title: Head of Dubai-based ports giant quits after Epstein links revealed
item.content:encoded: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem’s exit comes after files showed he appears to have exchanged hundreds of emails with Epstein.

item.title: Why you should consider switching bank accounts
item.content:encoded: Martin Lewis explains why now might be a good time to think about changing your bank account.

item.content:encoded: Martin Lewis explains why now might be a good time to think about changing your bank account.

item.title: Hello Kitty designer steps down after 46 years
item.content:encoded: Yuko Yamaguchi oversaw the feline character's rise to global icon status.

item.title: Trump revokes key climate ruling which he says has made cars pricier
item.content:encoded: The White House calls it the largest deregulation in US history, but environmentalists say it will prove costly for Americans.

item.title: AirAsia accused by artist for allegedly using his work without consent
item.content:encoded: A Penang-based street artist says his work has been "reproduced" as part of a livery on an aircraft

item.title: AI safety leader says 'world is in peril' and quits to study poetry
item.content:encoded: It comes in the same week an OpenAI researcher resigned amid concerns about its decision to start testing ChatGPT ads.

item.title: Taylor Swift asks US government to block 'Swift Home' trademark
item.content:encoded: Her team argued that a bedding firm's designs showed similarities to her trademarked signature.

item.title: Costs from Trump's tariffs paid mainly by US firms and consumers, NY Fed says
item.content:encoded: Last year, collective import tariff rates on various goods coming into the US more than tripled.

item.title: AI coding platform's flaws allow BBC reporter to be hacked
item.content:encoded: Vibe-coding tools - which let people without coding skills create apps using AI - are exploding in popularity.

item.title: Rain and politics driving up half-term holiday bookings, travel agents say
item.content:encoded: The Advantage Travel Partnerships says rain plus the political environment is creating a "powerful psychological need for escape".

item.title: The US economy is growing - so where are all the jobs?
item.content:encoded: As hiring rates and job openings drop, some worry a tough job market could be here to stay.

item.title: Get a grip: Robotics firms struggle to develop hands
item.content:encoded: Developing a durable and affordable hand is one of the biggest challenges in robotics.

item.title: US antitrust chief resigns amid tensions with Trump officials
item.content:encoded: The departure of Gail Slater has raised questions about the White House's approach to policing big mergers and monopolies.

item.title: FTC warns Apple over alleged lack of conservative news
item.content:encoded: The tech giant is facing pressure over claims that its news app does not feature articles from conservative outlets.

item.title: Salmon exports remain high but Scotch whisky falls
item.content:encoded: Scottish salmon exports increased in tonnage by 9%, while the volume of Scotch whisky exports dropped by 4.3%.

item.title: Tesco plans to give under-18s Clubcard access this year
item.content:encoded: Consumer outlet Which? has been campaigning on access to loyalty schemes, calling it a "huge win for shoppers".

item.title: Probe ordered into Daily Mail owner's £500m takeover of Telegraph
item.content:encoded: Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy orders a review of the deal on public interest and competition grounds.

item.title: Thousands queue as beauty store arrives on island of Ireland
item.content:encoded: Almost 2,000 people joined the queue for the opening of a new store in Belfast this morning.

item.title: 'Tens of thousands' affected by law firm collapse
item.content:encoded: The Solicitors Regulation Authority say an investigation into PM Law's collapse is ongoing.

item.title: Who is billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe and how did he make his money?

item.title: Reeves says 'more to do' after sluggish GDP growth
item.content:encoded: The chancellor's comments came after figures showed the UK economy saw a lacklustre end to 2025.

item.title: Civil service pension backlog 'overwhelmed' Capita, boss says
item.content:encoded: Thousands of retiring civil servants have been left without pension payments causing hardship for some.

item.title: Father of Coronation Street star to climb Everest on behalf of son and other deaf children
item.content:encoded: Michael Woods says he is inspired by his actor son Joseph, who plays Aled Winter-Brown.

item.title: The Dutch love four-day working weeks, but are they sustainable?
item.content:encoded: The Netherlands has the lowest working hours in Europe, but some say it is harming its economy.

item.title: Lloyds Banking Group to close another 95 branches
item.content:encoded: The closures have been announced days after Santander said it would shut branches.

item.title: Student beats seven other comedians to be crowned UK's pun champion
item.content:encoded: Adam Ernest Pickard beat seven other comedians to claim the 2026 title at the Leicester Comedy Festival.

item.title: Somalian airline praises pilot for crash-landing faulty plane, saving all 55 on board
item.content:encoded: All 55 people on board survived after the plane failed to land on the runway near the shoreline.

item.content:encoded: What to know about the two firms' blockbuster battle to control Warner Bros Discovery.

item.content:encoded: The warm-water turtle is assessed and taken to a specialist centre for treatment.

item.content:encoded: Innovative tech scares fish away from nuclear cooling pipes.

item.title: Why food fraud persists, even with improving tech
item.content:encoded: Even with sophisticated technology it is still difficult to detect fake foods.

item.title: Plane makers chase Asia's super-rich with luxe new private jets
item.content:encoded: Parts of the aviation industry are shifting towards wealthy customers and selling a more luxurious type of international travel.

item.title: Kids can be the harshest critics…
item.content:encoded: The candidates test their story on a group of kids.

item.content:encoded: Martin Lewis explains.

item.title: The real impact of roadworks on the country - and why they're set to get worse
item.content:encoded: There is a fine balance between the benefits of improved infrastructure, versus the cost of disruption. Does the country have it right?

item.title: Why the railways often seem to be in such chaos over Christmas
item.content:encoded: Parts of Britain’s rail network will close for engineering work over the festive period - but is that the right time to do it?

item.title: Budget 2025: What's the best and worst that could happen for Labour?
item.content:encoded: Three days in, after a tax U-turn and partial climbdown on workers' rights, Laura Kuenssberg looks at what impact Budget week might have.

item.content:encoded: Ahead of this week's Budget, some have accused the Office for Budget Responsibility of being a "straitjacket on growth"
